title: Red Sox legend revealed on ‘Masked Singer’ premiere
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: TV David Ortiz appeared on the show as “Googly Eyes,” performing DJ Snake and Lil Jon’s “Turn Down for What.

” Big Papi might be known for his connection to a Green Monster, but he was revealed to be the celeb behind a red monster costume on Wednesday night’s Season 14 premiere of “The Masked Singer” on Fox.
The reality TV singing competition features celebrities performing popular songs while disguised in elaborate full body costumes.

title: Trump administration continues to target Boston’s ‘sanctuary’ policies as Wu, local pols respond to Minn. ICE shooting
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News With local anger against ICE growing, the federal government is keeping up its attempt to invalidate local policies meant to protect immigrants.
A memorial for Renee Nicole Good near the site of her shooting in Minneapolis.

Stephen Maturen / Getty Images As Massachusetts leaders registered their shock and anger over the killing of a woman by an ICE officer in Minnesota Wednesday, the Trump administration argued in court documents that Boston’s so-called “sanctuary” policy is “obstructionist” and “unlawfully discriminates” against the federal government.

title: Man charged in Snapchat hacking allegedly targeted Northeastern, Colby students
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Federal prosecutors say the 26-year-old Illinois man phished access codes from nearly 600 women in an attempt to obtain nude images.

Rodrique Ngowi / AP, File Federal prosecutors in Boston have charged an Illinois man with phishing Snapchat access codes from nearly 600 women in an attempt to steal nude photos he allegedly kept, sold, or traded — a scheme that investigators say included working with a Northeastern track coach convicted of accessing female athletes’ social media accounts.
Massachusetts U.
